content.description: Two uniformly charged nonconducting spheres, each with diameter <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"> <mi>D</mi> </math>, are placed such that their surfaces are separated by a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>, as shown. The magnitudes of the charges of the spheres are <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 Q" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, as indicated in the figure.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the electric force exerted by one sphere on the other?
